intro: Manettia mollis, commonly known as the velvetleaf or silverleaf, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and velvety, dark green leaves. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. Manettia mollis thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking a lush, textured foliage plant.
